text: Harold Gordon Fowler was a sailor from Great Britain, who represented his country at the 1924 Summer Olympics in Meulan and Le Havre, France. Fowler took the silver in the 8 Metre and 7th in the Monotype. He also competed at the 1928 Summer Olympics in Amsterdam, Netherlands, where he became 8th in the 1928 competition. == Sources == * Category:Olympic sailors of Great Britain Category:1899 births Category:1975 deaths Category:British male sailors (sport) Category:Sailors at the 1924 Summer Olympics – 8 Metre Category:Sailors at the 1924 Summer Olympics – Monotype Category:Sailors at the 1928 Summer Olympics – 12' Dinghy Category:Olympic silver medallists for Great Britain Category:Olympic medalists in sailing Category:People from Donington, Lincolnshire Category:Medalists at the 1924 Summer Olympics
title: Gordon Fowler
